General Rules
1. The site-wide rules apply. Read them and then do not break them. Some of them are so important they're listed here as well, because redundancy is your friend.
2. Play to win. Most players want to win legitimately, don't ruin their enjoyment by playing against your wincon.
3. If you have the ability to edit or delete your posts in this thread, don't do it.
4. Do not quote anywhere any PMs between you and me (including role PMs), or anything else that originated outside of the game thread. This includes PM timestamps and anything else which games the system. Paraphrasing is allowed. If in doubt, ask.
5. Do not use cryptography, invisible text, tiny text, or anything like that.
6. Do not impersonate or pretend to be the moderator. Blue is my color, don't use it or anything close to it.
7. Unless the moderator has specifically told you it is allowed, do not talk about this game outside of this game thread or QTs I provide you until I have announced that the game is over.
8. Do not bring outside factors into this game. This includes, among other things, making bets, promises of real life rewards, etc.
9. Do not use any form of provable randomness. Claiming you rolled dice and acting on that is fine. Using dice tags is not.
10. Pretending to break a rule will be treated the same as breaking the rule. It's up to my discretion whether I think you pretended to break or rule or not, so if you're not sure, ask first.
11. We're all here to have fun. Tempers may flare, but avoid personal attacks and keep it civil. I will have very little tolerance if someone complains about the way you're talking to them.
12. Breaking one of these rules may, at my discretion, result in a modkill. If you are modkilled, you will become a Neutral Survivor, and thus automatically lose. Modkilling may or may not end the game day.
13. I reserve the right to change the rules. Rule changes will be updated here as well as posted in thread.
14. If you are dead, that is it. Do not post. Not even a "Bah" post.
15. If I happen to not be online but you know the game is over (for example, if scum get a quicklynch in during LyLo), please let me post the final scene before revealing the ending or otherwise discussing the game.

Voting Rules
1. Votes must be bolded, and in the format of VOTE: Player, using either the bold or the vote tags. Abbreviations, missing punctuation, and misspellings will be accepted as long as it is obvious to me who is being voted for. IMPORTANT: If I perceive it as a vote, it counts as a vote, even if it doesn't follow these rules exactly!
2. Unvoting is nice, but is not necessary.
3. You may vote to No Lynch, that requires the same number of votes as a lynch vote.
4. Once a majority of votes is reached (# of players / 2 + 1, rounded down), that person is lynched.
5. All living players, including the lynchee, may continue to post until I lock the thread.


Activity Rules. Read these, I'm anal about them.
1. If a player goes 48 real life hours (see rule #4 under Deadlines) without posting, I will prod them. Prods will be announced in thread.
2. If a player does not respond to their prod within 24 real life hours, or is prodded three times in total within the game, I will seek a replacement. 3. If the player comes back before a replacement is found I may allow them to continue. If this occurs when there is only one scum left in the game, or any other combination of roles which would clearly identify someone's alignment if something happens, I will extend the deadline until a replacement is found and can be given time to catch up (usually 24 hours). Other extensions will be dealt with on a case-by-case basis.
4. If you will be V/LA, please alert me in the thread. Don't PM me, don't post in the V/LA thread, post in this thread. Otherwise I'll probably prod and possibly replace you.
5. The 48 hours on the weekends count as 24 hours for activity, give or take. I'm not going to let people slide by posting once towards the end of Friday and then again on late Monday without a prod. - See Deadline Rule 4 for additional information

Deadlines.
1. Day one and two will have a deadline of fourteen real life days. Subsequent days will have a deadline of ten real life days.
2. In the event deadline is reached before a lynch has occurred, a No Lynch occurs.
3. The 48 hours on the weekends count as 24 hours for activity, give or take. I'm not going to let people slide by posting once towards the end of Friday and then again on late Monday without a prod.

Game Setup
This game has been approved for normalcy and balance. Normal game rules can be found here

It is guaranteed that at least 1 person will receive the following Vanilla Townie role PM

Player, You are a Vanilla Townie you only have your voice and your vote.

Win Condition: You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least 1 town aligned player alive.

In a City of Palermo, the mafia godfather spent years expanding his crime family into the United States, he worked hard planting it's members into each and every town. They were highly skilled and well trained. They also learned everything they could about American culture so they could blend in and disguise themselves. Then one day, the town hero Jake from State Farm was shot execution style and a note that simply said "Cosa Notra". It was time for the members to take over the town.

The members of the town were understandably afraid, even in the presence of experienced law enforcement and FBI Agents. Only time will tell who the survivors are.

Role PMs are going out this morning and the game will start when everyone has confirmed.

Everyone has confirmed

PeaceBringer's posts rubbed me the wrong way, buuuuuuuut
-PeaceBringer comes from an older site meta, a site meta I am less familiar with. The thought that this kind of behavior wasn't unusual at the time PeaceBringer was more active crossed my mind.
-PeaceBringer's voters didn't look good to me at all.
-The wagon seemed too easy.
-I also thought that PeaceBringer mighta done the posting intentionally, to invoke this type of reaction. To lure scum into revealing themselves via voting on an easy wagon.

There are counter-points to each of those that make it possible PeaceBringer is scum, hence the weak suspicion. Being that the posts do rub me the wrong way, it's not impossible that this type of attitude was common from PeaceBringer's time coming from scum, it's also possible PeaceBringer had adapted to current site meta, I could be wrong about PeaceBringer's voters, "too scummy to be scum is a fallacy", and the whole argument for PeaceBringer being town relies on a lot of assumptions on my part.

I don't currently think PeaceBringer is scum, but I do have PeaceBringer in my radar as possible-scum.
Does it feel comfortable on that fence?

For the record--Matias is not a townread.

The things Matias say are decently town enough, but I vaguely know Matias well enough to know he's a decently-competent scum player, who can fake town words to establish towncred. The important bit about Matias, therefore, isn't what he says...but what he does. And that has me deeply concerned. Why? Simple: his money doesn't seem to be where his mouth is. How?

He says there's scum voting PeaceBringer...and then votes outside the people who were voting PeaceBringer. In fact, voting for someone who was suspicious of the third voter on said wagon.

It's not a scumread yet, because I'd be the first to admit I can't read vets worth a damn. But it's a deeply-concerned-about very-low-null read.

That's not really a question.

PeaceBringer is not a current scum candidate, but I have my eye on him. Period. There's nothing else to say. There's no comfort to be had in a read. (Well, not yet, anyway. ) If I have reason to like a read, or if I have reason to be uncomfortable with a read, it'll be brought up. For instance, if I suddenly got second-thoughts on Brian, "I really don't like this", followed by an exploration of why my gut didn't like the wagon, and what to do now that I didn't like that wagon, along with what it meant. Or in the opposite example, "I really, really like this Brian wagon", along with finding the explanation for why my gut thinks that it's the right thing, and what it means.

It's not really complicated. PeaceBringer will be where PeaceBringer will be. If by, say, day three, I still haven't gotten a solid read one way or the other, then that is reason to be concerned. Then that null becomes (by the very act of being null) scum. But until then, I'll let you know if my read changes on PeaceBringer if my read actually changes. Same with every player. At this very moment, it hasn't; still there are that level.

Oh, and I meant it when I said that I'll mainly be sheeping ABR. While I certainly don't intend to copy him (my reads should be proof of that), I DO intend to trust him. For better or for worse.

For instance, one such factoid is the well-known bit about Mastin meta. As scum, I start out strong. Push aggressively, and get universal townreads as a result. (And, yes. They are universal.) But as the game goes on, those townreads begin to degenerate and even reverse into scumreads, as people begin to realize their read on me was stale and based off of early strengths that I lacked in the current mid/late-game. As town, I start off far less powerfully--I may be aggressive, but I lack the certainty and the conviction my scum-self has. Because of that doubt in myself, others doubt me and as a result, I draw a fair bit of early-attention. Yet if I continue to live, I can reverse that around, by gaining confidence in myself and ultimately, scumhunting strongly and aggressively. Granted, because I know this meta, I can subvert it. I can change it. And by bringing it up, I could theoretically be scum-mimicking-my-town-meta of starting weakly and getting stronger. All true.

But I'm not using my meta as a defense, here. (Theoretically, I could be, yeah, sure, but I'm not. ) I'm using it as a mild offensive, to demonstrate why circumstances of a player can make the difference. The circumstances of my particular meta, the example that I'm using, can make a huge difference, and you've ignored that in favor of a generality. Specifics in a game are important, and you brushing them off to make these broad statements is incredibly advantageous to a scum wincon.

Mith wrote: Mafia Specific Rules

Breaking rules, not posting, or certain other behavior may result in a modkill or replacement in affected games; rules regarding this should be (and generally are) included up front by the Game Moderator. Some rules apply to most games, and should be assumed to hold unless the Game Moderator explicitly says otherwise. These are:

Do not attempt to play the same game under more than one name.
Do not bring outside influences into the game - this includes threats, bribes, wagers, promises, "trust tells", alliances, etc. Using knowledge from previous games is perfectly acceptable, but try not to carry grudges from one game to another.
Do not talk outside the game thread about an ongoing game except where explicitly allowed to do so by your role/moderator. Likewise, do not use bbcode to hide secret messages - this equates to discussion outside the thread.
Do not edit/delete posts.
Do not quote communications with the moderator (in particular, your role PM). Paraphrasing is usually ok.
Do not post in the game after you are dead or replaced. Some moderators do allow contentless "Bah!" posts, but you should never reveal information once you are dead.
Play to win the game.

Aside from my theory above, I'm not ok with force-replacing from just a gut standpoint. This is a game. The rule being quoted is a subjective one. We can't let mafiascum establish the precedent of forcing out players we don't like.

@ABR: If they don't replace him and you quit, I will never respect you again. I thought you were a more honorable player than that, but maybe it's just your signature.
No, Banksys. PeaceBringer is violating the spirits of the rules by not playing the game nor trying to win the game. See, there are two halves of the objective. One is to win. Winning is an element of a game. But the other element of the game is having fun. And that objective is equally as important.

PeaceBringer isn't playing the game. That goes against the spirit of mafia, regardless of PeaceBringer's role. As scum, it sabotages the slot. As town, it sabotages the slot. It's actually less damaging to the game if PeaceBringer were town, simply because the town has more numbers and can therefore take more of a hit.

Also, there's the matter of "fair". Imagine taking this scenario to the extreme: in a 3P lylo, there's a conftown player, a scum, and a different town player--the different town player votes the conftown. That is unfair to the town, in that the town player was playing against their wincon, but it's also unfair to the scum, because the scum just had their win cheapened. Instead of earning their victory, it was literally just given to them. Nobody is left happy in this scenario. PeaceBringer is a less extreme version of that.

If PeaceBringer continues to exist in the game, it's not fair to the town to have him sabotaging his faction's chance to win. It's not fair to the scum because PeaceBringer is making the game more easy for them to win, and they won't feel they've earned a win when PeaceBringer helped literally just hand the win to them. Vice-versa if PeaceBringer is scum! PeaceBringer's scumbuddies would be royally ticked off that PeaceBringer sabotaged their chances of winning. And I know that, as town, I wouldn't feel like I earned my victory with him as scum; I'd feel he gave it to me.

So regardless of PeaceBringer's alignment, him not playing the game is unfair to everyone else in the game and is deeply, deeply disrespectful to any player regardless of their alignment. Because when you sign up to play a game, you should actually be playing the damn game, and PeaceBringer has demonstrated that he is not. Thus, the force-replacement requests are not unjustified. Perhaps you have a point, in that they're premature. Ideally, the solution isn't to force PeaceBringer out, but to force PeaceBringer to play the damn game. But failing that, and failing PeaceBringer asking to be replaced, a ticked off player has every right to ask the mod to intervene because it's ruining the game for both sides (in different ways) via the sabotage.

Now, ideally, you'll understand that. And act in a mature manner. But I hate to be this blunt, yet it's necessary: if you can't recognize the above, you don't deserve to be playing. You need to keep your emotions under control and think about the broader picture of the game. In which, you'll see that there's more to it than what you're showing. Players aren't asking PeaceBringer to be force-replaced because they want a tactical advantage. They're asking for PeaceBringer to be force-replaced because he's making the game environment miserable for multiple players, dragging the whole game down.

Imagine instead a player delivering many personal insults against players. There's a reason that it's considered a bannable offense nowadays and even before it was, most mods seeing that harassment would force-replace the offending player. Because it destroys the core reasons for playing the game. Again, PeaceBringer is not showing that extreme--but he IS showing that type of attitude, of not caring about others and being considerate of them.

He has already been replaced.

Move on, shall we?
